item.title: Report E-2024080369
item.description:
Report E-2024080369

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-12
  • City: EAST SAINT LOUIS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 12, 2024, at 1321 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in East St. Louis, Illinois regarding the release of Eterset 2950 (UN1866, Resin Solution, 3, III). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 5 ounces of ETERSET 2950 from (1) 55-gallon DM that impacted a 5ft x 5ft area of the trailer floor. Contractors could not determine the cause of the release. Contractors placed the damaged drum with residual product in an overpack to be forwarded on to the original consignee, then cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 5-gallon DF and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • Description: A shipment of"general cargo" was tendered by Expeditors under the airway bill: 157-30872811, with a total of 61 pieces. Out of the 61 pieces, 1 had a battery label, which was identified by GHA and was reported to airline. piece was placed on hold and shipper was advised. Revised AWB matching withe cargo was sent by the shipper. i

item.title: Report E-2024080383
item.description:
Report E-2024080383

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: FRANKFORT
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 31, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools, and all impacted freight was wiped down with absorbent pads and cleaners. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080324
item.description:
Report E-2024080324

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 29, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN2680 was torn in transit and released approximately twenty (20) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the site. All loose product, the damaged bag, and PPE were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080214
item.description:
Report E-2024080214

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 19, 2024, at 0938 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Dayton Freight Lines personnel in Des Plaines, Illinois regarding the release of PERMAFIL® 74035 (UN3082, Environmentally hazardous substance, liquid, n.o.s, 9, III). Contractors were dispatched and upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 55 gallons from (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted a 8ft x 20ft area of the trailer floor, and a 5ft x 10ft area of concrete. The damaged drum was placed in a 85-gallon overpack and contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DM's, and (1) 85-gallon DM which was then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.
